definitions: To cook (an egg) without its shell in or over boiling water.
To cook (fish, chicken, etc.) in a small amount of simmering liquid.
To hunt or catch (game or fish) illegally on land that is not one's own or in contravention of official protection.
To take (something) in an unfair or unlawful way.
examples: She likes to poach eggs for breakfast.
The chef will poach the salmon in white wine.
They were caught trying to poach deer.
The company tried to poach our best employees.
